overview: Externally, the vessel exhibits widespread coating failure and severe corrosion localized at stiffening rings, flanges, and small-bore nozzles. One small nozzle shows through‑wall perforation. Internals appear fair from limited views. The unit is stored on cribbing with corroded lifting lugs; reconditioning and code re‑evaluation are required prior to service.

recommendedActions.action: Abrasive blast exterior and perform UT mapping
MT/PT ring-to-shell and nozzle welds after cleaning
Replace perforated nozzle and degraded flanges/bolting
Internal cleaning and visual; spot UT and hardness checks
Hydrotest and re-rate per code after repairs
Apply new protective coating; add weep holes at rings

recommendations.label: UT mapping and weld NDE
recommendations.summary: Map thickness and examine ring/nozzle welds post-cleaning
actions: MT/PT welds at rings and nozzles

recommendations.label: Replace failed small nozzle
recommendations.summary: Remove and replace perforated nozzle and pad

recommendations.label: Recoat and add drainage
recommendations.summary: Exterior coating system with ring weeps to avoid water traps

additionalNotes: Mock dataset for UI validation of analysis rendering and downstream population.
